text: Assuming you’re interviewing a senior I like to ensure they know all the SOLID principles, and any additional design patterns for an opener question, scheduling (rx included) and concurrency is always fun to discuss
More often than not I find one of the better revealing questions is to question their knowledge of any libraries/frameworks they’ve mentioned in their application
Its quite easy to know the api for retrofit, but its something else to understand how it works internally etc
and a couple of my preferred gotchas, when might `onPause` and `onStop` *not* get called, and the difference between the available Rx Schedulers
oh, and why you shouldn’t use `Observable.create`

Hey Android developers! If your are located on the east coast of the US and would be interested in an 100% remote contract to hire android role at a top fintech company on a new customer facing payments app- message me! The role is looking for someone with 2 years of professional android dev and restful services experience.

Hi all.  I am looking for a Senior Android dev / team lead available for steady work over the next year+ on an existing project.    Requirements are  1. consistent availability during the week. 2. Solid development skills. 3. Good communication skills.  4. Ability to take the initiative and lead other developers. DM me if you are interested and I can share specifics on the project.  The candidate can be located anywhere but should be available during part of the work day in US timezones.
